{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hand to knee gait in polio is characterized by the involvement of the quadriceps muscle. This muscle group, located in the front of the thigh, is responsible for extending the knee joint. In polio, weakness or paralysis of the quadriceps can lead to difficulty in fully extending the knee during the swing phase of walking, resulting in a compensatory movement pattern known as hand to knee gait.", "answer_choice": "C. Quadriceps"}
